VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were 1 confirmed incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. This was within investigation report 2025SIC0000274 dated 3/11/2025
which found the facility in noncompliance of a staff member slapping a youth. A
corrective action plan dated 04/04/2025 was approved that included the staff
member being involved being terminated from employment and implementation of
training and tapping out of staff members who are showing signs of being
frustrated.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
facility submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
reporting period as a result of the Interim inspection completed on 06/13/2024.
This CAP contained violations for an employee file not having a job description,
an employee who had been employed for more than one year did not have yearly
verification of being free from communicable tuberculosis, an employee being
promoted to a supervisor position without having two years of experience in a
child caring institution, not having an initial health screening completed within 24
hours of admission and completing an updated treatment plan late. The CAP
contained action steps that the Human Resources Department updated their
workflow to include follow up items such as signing job descriptions when an
individual is promoted and yearly TB screening. The nursing department updated
the new admit/transfer checklist requirements, and the Clinical Manager updated
the tracking system for report due dates. The facility is currently complying with
the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP compliance with no
noted concerns.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator reported
since the last reporting period the implemented CAPs appear to be assisting the
facility with maintaining compliance.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported there is a lot of staff instability and lack of structure in the house.
Staff stated the youth pick up the instability and there tend to be more negative
behaviors. Staff described feeling if there was more support on the front end of a
problem/issue there could possibly be more prevention of problems/issues in the
house.
Youth reported the house being "sometimes calm, sometimes chaotic." Youth
stated they felt "mostly safe" and identified having at least one staff member they
felt comfortable talking with if needed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on April 30, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
